title: Postponed 2025 A/L exams to resume today
byline: The remaining subjects of the 2025 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examination, which were postponed due to the disaster situation in the country, are scheduled to commence today (12).

title: Cuba defiant after Trump says island to receive no more Venezuelan oil or money
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday said no more Venezuelan oil or money will go to Cuba and suggested the Communist-run island should strike a deal with Washington, ramping up pressure on the long-time U.S. nemesis and provoking defiant words from the island’s leadership.

title: Deaths from Iran protests reach more than 500, rights group says
byline: Unrest in Iran has killed more than 500 people, a rights group said on Sunday, as Tehran threatened to target U.S. military bases if President Donald Trump carries out his renewed threats to intervene on behalf of protesters.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Uva, Eastern and Central provinces and Hambantota district, today (12), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ven. Elle Gunawansa Thero urges President to reshuffle Cabinet
byline: The Chairman of the National Movement for the Protection of the Nation, Venerable Elle Gunawansa Thero, has called for a Cabinet reshuffle by removing Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya from the post of Minister of Education.

title: Generator at Norochcholai power plant restored
byline: A generator at the Norochcholai Power Plant, which had been temporarily shut down for maintenance, has been restored.

title: Trump declares himself ‘Acting President of Venezuela’ days after Maduro capture
byline: A digitally altered image posted by President Donald Trump claims he is the “Acting President of Venezuela.” Trump made this claim amid intense international controversy following the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores.

title: Indian national arrested with stock of illegally imported cigarettes at BIA
byline: A group police officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have arrested a 56-year-old Indian national while in possession of 2,400 illegally imported cigarettes.

title: Chalamet beats DiCaprio at Hollywood’s Golden Globes
byline: Timothee Chalamet triumphed in one of the most competitive categories at the Golden Globes on Sunday, taking the trophy for best male actor in a movie musical or comedy for his role as a professional table tennis player in “Marty Supreme.”

title: China’s Foreign Minister arrives in Sri Lanka on transit visit
byline: The Foreign Minister of China, Wang Yi has arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake early this morning (12) during a transit stop en route to China following an official visit to South Africa.

title: Three dead, several injured in car–van collision in Mundalama
byline: At least three people have been killed and several others were injured in a head-on collision between a car and a van in Navadankulama, Mundalama, along the Puttalam–Colombo main road, police said.

title: Case against Keheliya and family to be recalled in February
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his son Ramith Rambukwella, his daughter Amali Nayanika Rambukwella, and one of their employees, Nipuni Krishnajina, be recalled on February 13.

title: Online shopping in future will be AI-driven, says Google CEO
byline: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced the launch of the Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP), saying that artificial intelligence (AI) agents will play a major role in the way people shop in the near future.

title: US Ambassador Julie Chung praises Sri Lanka as top surfing destination
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung has highlighted Sri Lanka’s appeal for surfing enthusiasts, sharing her personal experience on X (formerly Twitter).

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces.

title: Bilateral talks held between Sri Lanka and China’s Foreign Ministers
byline: The Foreign Minister of China, Wang Yi, met with Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, this morning (12) for a session of bilateral discussions.

title: Golden Globes 2026: The full list of winners
byline: The Golden Globe Awards have been handed out in Los Angeles, honouring the best in film and television of the past 12 months.

title: Australia moves India into highest-risk category for student visas, cites ‘emerging integrity risks’
byline: Australia has tightened checks for student visa applicants from India as it moved India into the ‘highest-risk’ category along with Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan.

title: Group including Wimal Weerawansa launch ‘Satyagraha’ near Edu. Ministry against reforms
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, along with a group of civil society representatives and others, have commenced a continuous ‘Satyagraha’ campaign in front of the Education Ministry.

title: ITAK decides not to support no-confidence motion to be brought against Education Minister
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) has decided not to support the no-confidence motion that is expected to be brought against Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Injunction order issued against Wimal Weerawansa and group staging ‘Satyagraha’ near Isurupaya
byline: An injunction order has been issued against a group of civil organization representatives, including leader of the National Freedom Front (NFF) Wimal Weerawansa, staging a ‘Satyagraha’ campaign launched this morning (12) opposite the Ministry of Education premises at ‘Isurupaya’, Battaramulla.

title: Sri Lanka seeks assistance from China to reconstruct roads and bridges damaged by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Sri Lanka has requested the assistance of the government of China to reconstruct roads, railways and bridges that were affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: North Korea says US making mockery of UN
byline: North Korea condemned on Monday (Jan 12) what it called “shameless” moves by the United States that it said undermined the United Nations and accused Washington of a “hideous criminal act”.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ national programme to be launched tomorrow
byline: The inauguration of ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ national programme will take place in Colombo tomorrow (13).

title: Mogo Studios releases trailer of Sri Lanka’s first animated film for global audience
byline: Mogo Studios has released the trailer of Sri Lanka’s first animated film for a global audience, “The Secret of the Moonstone”.

title: Meta blocks 550,000 accounts under Australia’s social media ban
byline: About 550,000 accounts were blocked by Meta during the first days of Australia’s landmark social media ban for kids.

title: Group including Wimal Weerawansa commences ‘Satyagraha’ near Edu. Ministry against reforms
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, along with a group of civil society representatives and others, have commenced a continuous ‘Satyagraha’ campaign in front of the Education Ministry.

title: Mogo Studios releases trailer of Sri Lanka’s first animated film for global audience
byline: Mogo Studios has released the trailer of Sri Lanka’s first animated film for a global audience, “The Secret of the Moonstone”.

title: Apple leads global smartphone market with 20% share in 2025
byline: Global smartphone shipments rose 2 per cent year-on-year in 2025, lifted by stronger demand and economic momentum in emerging markets, Counterpoint Research said on Monday.

title: Proposal to bring all microfinance and credit-providing institutions under single regulatory authority opposed
byline: Representatives of community-based financial societies have opposed the move to bring all microfinance and credit-providing institutions under a single regulatory authority through the enactment of the Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority Bill.

title: Prison inmates across Sri Lanka donate meals to support Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ victims
byline: The Department of Prisons in Sri Lanka has announced that inmates from ten prisons across the country have voluntarily donated their meals to provide relief to those affected by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: Over 65,000 tourists arrive in Sri Lanka so far in 2026
byline: A total of 67,762 tourists have arrived in the country in the first eight days of this year, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Govt hopeful of finalizing Hambantota SINOPEC Oil Refinery Project agreement in 1Q 2026
byline: The government is hoping to finalize the agreement related to the SINOPEC Oil Refinery Project in Hambantota in the first quarter of 2026.

title: Parliamentary Secretariat refutes news articles claiming Speaker directed to take action against its employees for using drugs
byline: The Parliamentary Secretariat has refuted news articles circulated in media under the headline “Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has decided to take strict action regarding a group of employees using drugs, alcohol and cigarettes within the Parliamentary premises.”

title: Man who attempted to attack police officers with a machete shot dead
byline: An individual who allegedly attempted to attack police officers with a sharp weapon in Welikanda, Polonnaruwa has been shot dead by police.

title: Welimada District Court Registrar arrested over alleged bribery incident remanded
byline: The Registrar of the Welimada District Court, who was arrested and remanded in connection with an alleged bribery incident, has been further remanded.

title: Police warn of surge in online financial scams
byline: The general public has been urged to exercise extreme caution when using social media platforms owing to a surge in financial scams online.

title: Trump to visit India next year, claims new US Ambassador Sergio Gor
byline: Earlier in the day, new US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, offered a positive outlook on India-US trade deal talks, claiming negotiations will start tomorrow, January 13. Gor also claimed US President Donald Trump may visit India next year.

title: Indian rocket launch loses control after liftoff in fresh blow to ISRO
byline: An Indian rocket carrying 16 loads of equipment and experiments including an earth surveillance satellite went off track after liftoff on Monday in a fresh setback to the workhorse launch vehicle of the Indian Space Research Organisation.

title: Highest temperature recorded in Katunayake, Lowest from Nuwara Eliya
byline: The highest temperature recorded in the country today (12) was 31.5°C, reported from the Katunayake Meteorological Station, the Department of Meteorology noted.

title: Minister Lal Kantha should immediately retract his statement: National Sangha Council
byline: If the government fails to take appropriate action against Minister K.D. Lal Kantha for making insulting and degrading remarks against the Maha Sangha, it will soon have to face serious consequences, the Chairman of the National Sangha Council, Venerable Liyanwala Sasana Rathana Thero stated.

title: One dead, six injured in road accident in Oyamaduwa
byline: An individual has died while six others have sustained injuries following a road accident in Oyamaduwa, Anuradhapura, police stated.

title: Four killed in bus-car head-on collision in Murasumoddai
byline: Four persons have died in a road accident along the Paranthan–Mullaitivu road in Murasumoddai, Kilinochchi, this evening (12), police stated.

title: Satellite imagery reveals 4,800 landslides occurred in Sri Lanka in recent weeks
byline: Approximately 4,800 landslides have been identified through satellite-based assessments conducted following Cyclone Ditwah, the Director General of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies, Kumari Meegahakotuwa stated.

title: Trump weighs response to Iran crackdown, Tehran says communication open with US
byline: Iran said on Monday it is keeping communications open with the U.S. as President Donald Trump weighed responses to a deadly crackdown on nationwide protests, which pose one of the stiffest challenges to clerical rule since the 1979 Islamic Revolution.
